articles.headline: 2025 AAC college football projections, preview
articles.description: Bill Connelly previews the AAC, which could have some more surprise surges in store for 2025.

images.name: Blake Horvath makes Navy history with a 95-yard TD
images.caption: Blake Horvath keeps the ball and goes for a 95-yard rushing touchdown, the longest run in Navy history, to tie the score 14-14.

articles.headline: 2026 NFL draft: Ranking top five prospects at every position
articles.description: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

articles.headline: Oregon lands No. 1 safety Washington, nephew of Kobe Bryant
articles.description: Four-star prospect Jett Washington, ESPN's No. 1 safety in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Oregon over Alabama and USC on Thursday night.

articles.headline: Brandon Arrington, No. 1 athlete prospect in 2026, picks Texas A&M
articles.description: Brandon Arrington, the No. 1 athlete prospect and 14th overall recruit in the 2026 ESPN 300, has committed to Texas A&M.

articles.headline: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
articles.description: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

article.headline: Pitt passes for 6 TDs, Ball State routs Fordham 57-29
article.description: Drew Pitt passed for 439 yards and a school-record-tying six touchdowns and Ball State won its 10th straight home opener with a 57-29 victory over Fordham on Saturday.
article.linkText: Pitt passes for 6 TDs, Ball State routs Fordham 57-29

images.name: Plitt and Riley connect on the deep ball
images.caption: Drew Plitt throws back-to-back deep throws to Riley Miller, with the second going for a 28-yard touchdown.

video.headline: Plitt and Riley connect on the deep ball
video.caption: Drew Plitt throws back-to-back deep throws to Riley Miller, with the second going for a 28-yard touchdown.
video.title: Plitt and Riley connect on the deep ball
video.description: Drew Plitt throws back-to-back deep throws to Riley Miller, with the second going for a 28-yard touchdown.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Plitt and Riley connect on the deep ball) 2019/09/07 ESHEET

article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. -- Drew Plitt passed for 439 yards and a school-record-tying six touchdowns and Ball State won its 10th straight home opener with a 57-29 victory over Fordham on Saturday. Plitt's passing yardage is the fourth highest in team history and the 57 points is the Cardinals' fourth highest total all-time. The Cardinals scored a team-record 66 points in a 1977 win over Cal Poly Pomona. Plitt's six TD passes matched the mark set by Keith Wenning in 2013 in a win over Miami (Ohio). Fordham (0-2) jumped out to a 7-0 first-quarter lead on Zach Davis' 2-yard run. Plitt answered for Ball State (1-1), connecting with Justin Hall on a 50-yard scoring strike to knot the score at 7. The Rams reclaimed the lead when Tim DeMorat hooked up with Jack Lynch for a 5-yard score, but Walter Fletcher's 10-yard TD run with 57 seconds left in the first quarter tied the game at 14-all. Plitt, who completed 32 of 40 passes in the game, tossed two TD passes in the second quarter -- a 3-yarder to Cody Rudy and a 40-yard scoring strike to Antwan Davis -- for a 28-14 halftime lead. Ball State used a safety, Plitt's 3-yard TD toss to Riley Miller and a 16-yard TD run by Caleb Huntley to forge a 43-14 lead. Plitt and Miller teamed up for a 28-yard scoring strike in the third quarter and Pitt capped his performance with a 4-yard scoring strike to Antwan Davis early in the fourth quarter. Miller finished with six catches for 116 yards and Davis snagged five passes for 86 yards. DeMorat, the reigning Patriot Football League offensive player of the week, completed 20 of 35 passes for 221 yards with one TD and two interceptions. Zach Davis carried 19 times for 85 yards for the Rams, while Trey Sneed had two short TD runs.

videos.headline: Plitt and Riley connect on the deep ball
videos.description: Drew Plitt throws back-to-back deep throws to Riley Miller, with the second going for a 28-yard touchdown.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Plitt and Riley connect on the deep ball) 2019/09/07 ESHEET
